justification: The methods section states that “Each trial involved the auditory presentation of random digits…,” and the authors explicitly use this 1-back task as the concurrent secondary task “expected to reduce the capacity for domain-general cognitive control,” indicating it serves as the measure of that construct.

The paper explains that they “tackled this issue with a semantic selection task,” in which participants chose the correct feature among distractors; this task was designed to “investigate the fine-grained impact of the relevance of both target and distracter features on the semantic selection process,” making it the instrument for assessing semantic control.
